# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:
  
* Name: `weight`
* Label: `weight of the participant in kg`
* Type of variable: `countinous`
* Missings: 
    + `991 = CAPI/interviewer error`
    + `992 = Impute`
    + `993 = Disable to measure`
    + `994 = Not attempt/not done`
    + `995 = Does not answer`
    + `996 = Not applicable`
    + `997 = Refuse`
    + `998 = Do not know`
    + `999 = Missing`
* Comments: `Weight should be collected in kilograms. It should be determined wheather the  variable was collected through a self reported measure or an athropometric test.`

### COURAGE - Finnish - Wave 1 

#### Study-specific variables

The study-specific variable elected to be harmonised is:

* Name: `q2507_weight`
* Label: `weight`
* Type of variable: `countinous`
* Missings
    + `997 = Disable to measure`
    + `998 = Refusal`

```{r assign_fin}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'COURAGE_fin_w1_weig','Courage.Courage_Finland_w1',
                         variables=list('q2507_weight'), missings = TRUE)
```

```{r local_fin}
COURAGE_fin_w1_weig <- opal.execute(o,'COURAGE_fin_w1_weig')
Continuous_summary(var = COURAGE_fin_w1_weig$q2507_weight, missing_values = c(997,998))
ggplot(COURAGE_fin_w1_weig, aes(q2507_weight)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab("Weight") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
The harmonized variable is the same than the study-specific variable, but the missing values have to be recoded as follows:

* `NA into 999`
* `997 into 993`
* `998 into 997`

R code of the ALGORITHM:

```{r harmo_fin}
COURAGE_ds_fin_w1 <- tibble(id=COURAGE_fin_w1_weig$id)
COURAGE_ds_fin_w1$weight <- car::recode(COURAGE_fin_w1_weig$q2507_weight, "NA=999; 997=993; 998=997")
COURAGE_ds_fin_w1$weight <- labelled(COURAGE_ds_fin_w1$weight, labels = c("Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not attempt not done"=994, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not applicable"=996, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

#### Statistics of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript_fin}
Continuous_summary(var = COURAGE_ds_fin_w1$weight, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))
ggplot(COURAGE_ds_fin_w1, aes(weight)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab("weight") + ylab("Frequency") 
```

#### Validation
There are unusual values lowers than 30
```{r crosstabulation_fin}
COURAGE_ds_fin_w1[which(COURAGE_ds_fin_w1$weight<30),]
```






### COURAGE - Polish - Wave 1 

#### Study-specific variables

The study-specific variable elected to be harmonised is:

* Name: `q2507_weight`
* Label: `weight`
* Type of variable: `countinous`
* Missings
    + `997 = Disable to measure`
    + `998 = Refusal`

```{r assign_pol1}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'COURAGE_pol_w1_weig','Courage.Courage_Poland_w1',
                         variables=list('q2507_weight'), missings = TRUE)
```

```{r local_pol1}
COURAGE_pol_w1_weig <- opal.execute(o,'COURAGE_pol_w1_weig')
Continuous_summary(var = COURAGE_pol_w1_weig$q2507_weight, missing_values = c(997,998))
ggplot(COURAGE_pol_w1_weig, aes(q2507_weight)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab("weight") + ylab("Frequency") + xlim(10,160)
ggplot(COURAGE_pol_w1_weig, aes(q2507_weight)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab("age") + ylab("Frequency") + xlim(460,1198) + ylim(0,6)
```

This variables have values from 10 untill 8740. I consider 35 as a minimum weigth and 160 as a maximum weigth that a person can have. 

#### Harmonisation algorithm
The harmonized variable is the same than the study-specific variable, but the missing values have to be recoded as follows:

* `NA into 999`
* `997 into 993`
* `998 into 997`


R code of the ALGORITHM:

```{r harmo_pol1}
COURAGE_ds_pol_w1 <- tibble(id=COURAGE_pol_w1_weig$id)
COURAGE_ds_pol_w1$weight <- car::recode(COURAGE_pol_w1_weig$q2507_weight, "161:hi=999; lo:34=999; NA=999; 997=993; 998=997")
COURAGE_ds_pol_w1$weight <- labelled(COURAGE_ds_pol_w1$weight, labels = c("Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not attempt not done"=994, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not applicable"=996, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

#### Statistics of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript_pol1}
Continuous_summary(var = COURAGE_ds_pol_w1$weight, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))
ggplot(COURAGE_ds_pol_w1, aes(weight)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab("weight") + ylab("Frequency") + xlim(35,160)
```

#### Validation
There are some unusual values that are lower than 30 and upper than 250 kg
```{r crosstabulation_pol1}
COURAGE_pol_w1_weig[which(COURAGE_pol_w1_weig$q2507_weight<30 | (COURAGE_pol_w1_weig$q2507_weight>250 & COURAGE_pol_w1_weig$q2507_weight<900)),]
```
